definitions: writing instrument with small rotating ball dispensing ink
examples: She signed the contract with a blue ballpoint pen
The ballpoint stopped writing when the ink ran out

definitions: large room designed for formal dancing and social events
examples: The wedding reception was held in the hotel's grand ballroom
They took ballroom dancing lessons every Saturday evening

definitions: fragrant healing or soothing ointment applied to skin
something that brings comfort or relief to distress
examples: She applied lip balm to prevent chapping in winter
The nurse spread healing balm on the patient's wound
Music was a balm for her troubled soul
His kind words served as balm to her wounded pride

definitions: extremely light tropical wood used for models and rafts
examples: He built model airplanes from balsa wood sheets
The life raft was constructed with balsa for buoyancy

definitions: fragrant resinous substance obtained from various trees and plants
garden plant with showy flowers and aromatic properties
examples: The ancient Egyptians used balsam in their embalming process
Canada balsam is used to mount microscope slides
She planted colorful balsam flowers along the garden border
The balsam fir releases a pleasant fragrance when touched

definitions: ornamental railing with supporting balusters along staircases or balconies
examples: She leaned against the marble balustrade overlooking the garden
The staircase featured an elegant wrought-iron balustrade

definitions: sudden loud sound or forceful impact noise
examples: The door slammed shut with a loud bam
We heard a bam when the car backfired suddenly

definitions: fast-growing woody tropical grass used for construction and food
examples: Pandas primarily feed on bamboo shoots and leaves
The house was built entirely from bamboo and thatch

definitions: official or legal prohibition against something or someone
examples: The city imposed a ban on smoking in restaurants
The travel ban prevented citizens from entering certain countries

definitions: state of being boring, predictable, or lacking in originality
examples: The movie's banality made it forgettable despite its budget
She was tired of the banality of everyday conversation

definitions: curved yellow fruit that grows in clusters on tropical plants
examples: She ate a banana for breakfast every morning
The banana bread recipe called for three ripe bananas

definitions: group of musicians who perform together regularly
thin flat strip of material forming a loop or ring
range of frequencies, values, or similar grouped items
examples: The rock band played at the festival last night
Her favorite band is touring Europe this summer
She wore a gold band on her wedding finger
The rubber band held the papers together securely
The satellite operates in the microwave frequency band
Students were grouped into ability bands for mathematics

definitions: strip of material used to bind wounds or injuries
examples: The nurse wrapped a bandage around his sprained ankle
She changed the bandage on the cut twice daily

definitions: large colored handkerchief typically worn around head or neck
examples: He wore a red bandana to keep sweat from his eyes
The cowboy tied a bandana around his neck for protection

definitions: pattern of stripes or bands as decoration or marking
practice of organizing into groups based on shared characteristics
examples: The vase featured intricate banding in gold and blue
Scientists use leg banding to track migratory birds
The school's banding system grouped students by ability level
Color banding appeared on the printed photograph

definitions: person who robs travelers, especially member of gang
examples: The bandit held up the stagecoach at gunpoint
Mountain bandits terrorized villages along the trade route

definitions: practice or acts of robbery and plunder by bandits
examples: Banditry was common along remote mountain passes
The government struggled to suppress banditry in rural areas

definitions: person who leads and conducts a musical band
examples: The bandleader counted off before each song began
Duke Ellington was a famous jazz bandleader and composer

definitions: covered outdoor platform where bands perform public concerts
examples: The brass band played Sunday concerts at the park bandstand
They danced near the bandstand during the summer festival

definitions: popular activity or cause that attracts increasing support
examples: Many investors jumped on the cryptocurrency bandwagon too late
Politicians joined the environmental bandwagon before the election

definitions: maximum rate of data transfer across a network path
range of frequencies within a continuous set of frequencies
examples: The video conference required more bandwidth than available
Their internet plan offers 100 megabits bandwidth per second
The amplifier has a bandwidth of 20Hz to 20kHz
Radio stations are assigned specific bandwidth for broadcasting

definitions: persistent source of annoyance, harm, or ruin
examples: Mosquitoes were the bane of their camping trip
Procrastination has been the bane of his academic career

definitions: sudden loud sound like an explosion or impact
fringe of hair cut straight across the forehead
sudden forceful blow or collision impact
examples: The firework exploded with a tremendous bang
We heard a bang when the door slammed shut
She trimmed her bangs to keep them above her eyebrows
The hairstylist recommended side-swept bangs for her face shape
He got a nasty bang on the head from the low ceiling
The car hit the wall with a loud bang

definitions: British term for sausage, especially pork sausage
old car in poor condition that makes noise
firework that makes a loud explosive sound
examples: He ordered bangers and mash at the British pub
The breakfast included eggs, beans, and two pork bangers
His first car was an old banger barely worth scrap
The banger broke down again on the motorway
Children set off bangers during the Guy Fawkes celebration
The banger exploded with a deafening crack

definitions: continuous loud hitting or knocking sounds
examples: The banging from upstairs kept everyone awake all night
We heard banging on the door during the storm

definitions: act of forcing someone to leave a place as punishment
examples: His banishment from court lasted for ten years
The criminal faced banishment from the kingdom

definitions: handrail with supporting posts along the side of stairs
examples: Children love sliding down the banister when adults aren't watching
She gripped the banister while climbing the steep stairs

definitions: musical instrument with circular body, long neck and strings
examples: He played bluegrass music on his five-string banjo
The banjo player led the folk band

definitions: establishment for keeping, lending, and exchanging money
sloping land alongside a river or lake
place where things are stored for future use
examples: She deposited her paycheck at the bank downtown
The bank approved their mortgage application yesterday
Wildflowers grew along the river bank in spring
They had a picnic on the grassy bank
The hospital maintains a blood bank for emergencies
Scientists store samples in the seed bank

definitions: person who manages or owns a bank or works in banking
examples: The investment banker advised on the corporate merger
She consulted her banker about the loan terms

definitions: business of operating a bank or financial services
tilting of aircraft when turning
examples: She studied banking and finance at university
Online banking has revolutionized how people manage money
The pilot practiced banking the plane smoothly through turns
Sharp banking was necessary to avoid the storm

definitions: piece of paper money issued by a central bank
examples: The new polymer banknotes are harder to counterfeit
She collected rare banknotes from different countries

definitions: person declared legally unable to pay their debts
examples: The bankrupt had to sell all assets to pay creditors
Many bankrupts struggle to rebuild their credit

definitions: legal state of being unable to repay debts
examples: The company filed for bankruptcy protection last month
Personal bankruptcy affected his credit rating for years

definitions: long strip of cloth bearing a slogan or design
rectangular advertisement displayed on a webpage
examples: Protesters carried banners demanding political reform
The victory banner hung across the main street
The banner ad appeared at the top of every page
Click-through rates for banner ads have declined

definitions: act of officially forbidding something
examples: The banning of plastic bags reduced environmental waste
Book banning remains controversial in many school districts

definitions: handrail and its supporting posts alongside a staircase
examples: The child held the bannister while learning to walk downstairs
They painted the wooden bannister white to match the walls

definitions: elaborate formal meal for many people celebrating special occasion
examples: The wedding banquet featured seven courses of gourmet food
Diplomats attended the state banquet at the palace

definitions: activity of holding or attending banquets
examples: The banqueting hall could accommodate five hundred guests
Medieval banqueting often lasted for several days

definitions: female spirit in Irish folklore whose wailing warns of death
examples: Legend says the banshee appears before a family death
She screamed like a banshee when she saw the spider

definitions: small domestic fowl or miniature breed of chicken
examples: The bantam rooster strutted around the farmyard proudly
Bantam eggs are smaller but taste the same

definitions: weight division in boxing for fighters typically under 118 pounds
examples: The bantamweight champion defended his title successfully
He moved up from bantamweight to featherweight division

definitions: playful and friendly exchange of teasing remarks
examples: Their witty banter entertained everyone at the party
The banter between the hosts made the show enjoyable

definitions: Christian religious rite of sprinkling water symbolizing purification
person's first experience of particular activity or situation
examples: The baby's baptism took place in the family church
Adult baptism requires conscious commitment to faith
Her first day was a baptism of fire in emergency medicine
The rookie's baptism into professional sports was challenging

definitions: building or part of church used for baptism ceremonies
examples: The medieval baptistery featured beautiful mosaic decorations
They gathered in the baptistery for the christening

definitions: part of church containing the baptismal font
examples: The baptistry was decorated with scenes from the Bible
Restoration work began on the ancient baptistry

definitions: establishment serving alcoholic drinks
solid piece of material longer than wide
legal profession or qualifying exam for lawyers
barrier preventing movement or access
examples: They met at the bar for drinks after work
The sports bar was packed during the game
She unwrapped a chocolate bar for dessert
The soap bar slipped from his wet hands
She passed the bar exam on her first attempt
Members of the bar must follow ethical guidelines
Security bars protected the windows from intruders
The steel bar blocked the emergency exit

definitions: sharp backward-pointing part preventing removal
deliberately hurtful remark
examples: The fishhook's barb prevented the fish from escaping
Barbed wire surrounded the military compound
Her barb about his appearance stung deeply
Political debates often include sharp barbs

definitions: person considered culturally primitive or uncivilized
examples: Romans called northern tribes barbarians
He ate like a barbarian at the formal dinner

definitions: extreme cruelty or brutal behavior
word or expression considered incorrect or non-standard
examples: The barbarism of war shocked international observers
Such barbarism has no place in civilized society
Using 'irregardless' is considered a barbarism by purists
The editor corrected several barbarisms in the manuscript
